articles.title: US Scheme for War against DPRK Flayed--Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
US Scheme for War against DPRK Flayed--Rodong Sinmun 
 Pyongyang, May 8 (KCNA) -- The U.S. warmongers are planning to stage joint military exercises with south Korean puppet forces on Paekryong Island in July under the pretence of "coping with the provocation of local war" by someone, according to a foreign news report. 
					 It is reported that the U.S. imperialists hasten the military confab with the south Korean puppet forces while making field survey of the island for the war exercises to be conducted with huge armed forces involved. 
					
					 This is a dangerous scheme for war aimed at surprise attack on the DPRK and a grave challenge to the world people desirous of denuclearization, peace and stability of the Korean Peninsula, Rodong Sinmun Sunday says in a signed commentary. 
					
					 It goes on: 
					
					 The U.S. imperialists' attempt for the war exercises on the island where a very tense situation prevails is a premeditated military provocation to the DPRK as it is designed to let the south Korean puppet forces ignite another warship sinking case and armed provocation in the West Sea. 
					
					 What is more dangerous is that the joint exercises on the island are to be staged in the territorial waters under the DPRK's sovereignty. 
					
					 Lurking behind such plan for staging the exercises on Paekryong Island, the most sensitive area, is a wicked intention to maintain the "northern limit line" at any cost and ignite a war against the DPRK anytime. 
					
					 Through the exercises, the U.S. imperialists seek to finally examine and round off the preparations for operation of surprise attack on the DPRK. To this end, they are going to bring huge armed forces of the U.S. Marine Corps to the area of Paekryong Island. 
					
					 Now the U.S. armed forces in the Asia-Pacific region, the U.S. mainland, Alaska, Japan and south Korea are conducting brisk maneuvers aiming at the DPRK under such war scenarios as "New OPLAN 5026". 
					
					 If the enemies dare to invade the DPRK, they will be doomed to a miserable fate.

articles.title: Suppression of Reunification Movement Slammed in S. Korea
articles.content:
Suppression of Reunification Movement Slammed in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, May 8 (KCNA) -- Ten odd political parties and civic and public organizations of south Korea called a press conference outside the puppet Police Agency on May 4 to condemn the suppression of the reunification movement organizations.
					 They included the Democratic Labor Party, the Solidarity for Progress, the Catholic Human Rights Committee and the Youth Solidarity.
					
					 Speakers at the conference noted that the police and the Intelligence Service that day kicked up a racket of arrest and search against former and incumbent members of the Youth and Students Solidarity for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration in Seoul, Kwangju, Taejon and Jeju Island.
					
					 They strongly denounced the security forces for repressing the activities of youth and students for independence, democracy and reunification on charges of "enemy-benefiting deed".
					
					 This is retaliation for the ruling party's defeat in the April 27 by-election, they pointed out.
					
					 The present authorities have employed retaliatory repression whenever they are judged by the people, they said, adding that the fact clearly disclosed the true colors of the dictatorial forces maintaining their remaining days through suppression of the pro-reunification patriotic forces and the people.
					
					 They declared that they would fight against the suppression by the security authorities and surely punish the present "government" by the strength of the people.

articles.title: Authorities' Anti-Reunification Deed Censured in S. Korea
articles.content:
Authorities' Anti-Reunification Deed Censured in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, May 8 (KCNA) -- The Media Headquarters and the Academic Headquarters of the South Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration issued a joint statement on May 4 denouncing the puppet authorities' suppression of the legitimate reunification movement organization.
					 The statement charged that the police and the Intelligence Service on the same day searched and arrested members of the Youth and Students Solidarity for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration on charges of violation of the "National Security Law".
					
					 The present "government" is incriminating the legitimate activities of the reunification movement organization and committing wholesale suppression of it, it said, branding this as a treacherous anti-reunification deed of blocking the peaceful reunification, the task of the national history.
					
					 The authorities are now trying to suffocate democracy by defining as "enemy-benefiting" and cracking down on the organizations which have called for the withdrawal of the U.S. forces from south Korea and the abolition of the NSL and taken the lead in the reunification movement, the statement charged.
					
					 It urged the "government" to stop at once the anti-reunification act of blocking the reunification movement and totally denying the June 15 joint declaration and set free the arrested members immediately.

articles.title: Self-righteous Behaviors of GNP Accused in S. Korea
articles.content:
Self-righteous Behaviors of GNP Accused in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, May 8 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Democratic Labor Party of south Korea on May 4 issued a commentary to condemn the "Grand National Party" for its self-righteous behaviors. 
					 The commentary noted that the GNP single-handedly railroaded a "motion on ratification of Free Trade Agreement" with the European Union through the "National Assembly" that day.  
					
					 The GNP can never be pardoned as it still behaves arrogantly and arbitrarily instead of reflecting on its wrongs after being punished by the people in the by-election, it said.
					
					 We strongly protest against the railroading of the "motion" that will bring small tradesmen to bay and drive the stockbreeding suffering from foot-and-mouth diseases into tighter corner, the commentary said.
					
					 It declared that DLP would fight it out to punish the GNP which sold off the south Korean economy to foreign forces lock, stock and barrel.

articles.title: Struggle for Workers' Rights Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Struggle for Workers' Rights Called for in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, May 8 (KCNA) -- Members of the Federation of Trade Unions for Democracy, the Confederation of Trade Unions and the Memorial Society for Martyr Kim Hon Jong in south Korea held a memorial service at Moran Park in Namyangju City, Kyonggi Province on May 4 at which they vowed to struggle for the workers' rights.
					 They recalled that Kim Hon Jong fought against unreasonable discrimination against part-time workers and for political right of the workers, democratization of society and independent reunification.
					
					 They declared that they would not stop the struggle to bring about a new world of independent reunification desired by Kim, a world in which the genuine right of the workers is ensured.

articles.title: S. Korean Puppet Troops in Afghanistan Attacked
articles.content:
S. Korean Puppet Troops in Afghanistan Attacked
 Pyongyang, May 8 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet troops in Afghanistan were attacked by rocket launchers on May 5, according to south Korean MBC.
					 Several shells suddenly hit the south Korean military base and its surrounding construction site at the dawn of the day.
					
					 There have been armed attacks on the troops and civilians of south Korea in Afghanistan since the south Korean puppet authorities dispatched its troops again to this country, pursuant to the U.S. imperialists' policy of aggression.

articles.title: S. Korea Plans to Stage Military Drills in MDL Area
articles.content:
S. Korea Plans to Stage Military Drills in MDL Area
 Pyongyang, May 8 (KCNA) -- The 30th Division of the south Korean puppet army is planning to stage field mobile drills in areas of Koyang, Phaju, Ryonchon, Tongduchon and Phochon of Kyonggi Province from May 16, according to south Korean Yonhap News.
					 The drills will reportedly last till June 1 with helicopters and equipment for preemptive attack and huge troops involved.
					
					 The south Korean puppet warmongers are getting hell-bent on the war maneuvers against the DPRK almost every day, turning their face away from the trend of the times toward dialogue and peace.

articles.title: Mexican Paper on DPRK's Efforts to Build Thriving Nation
articles.content:
Mexican Paper on DPRK's Efforts to Build Thriving Nation 
Pyongyang, May 8 (KCNA) -- The Mexican paper Unidad Nacional on April 30 carried a photo of General Secretary Kim Jong Il providing field guidance to the Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex and an article titled "DPRK's prospect of building a thriving nation".
					 The article said that this year the DPRK plans to continuously and vigorously step up the drive to put the production of consumer goods on a modern and scientific basis and carry on in a far-sighted way the modernization of light industry on an overall scale at the cutting-edge level, not partially at an ordinary level.
					
					More brisk all-people movement is going on in the DPRK to update local industrial factories across the country and run them in full capacity on the locally available raw materials under the torch of the local industry revolution Kim Jong Il kindled while giving field guidance to factories in Changsong County in November last year, it said.
					
					 The all-people and nationwide interest in the light industry, set as a main front of general offensive for this year, is remarkably increasing in the DPRK, the article said, adding that signal events are expected to take place one after another in the light industry of the DPRK.
					
					 The DPRK has already taken the position of a politico-ideological and military power and, accordingly, it can be definitely called a great prosperous and powerful country when it hits the goal for building an economic power to improve the standard of people's living, it stressed.

articles.title: Mongolian TV on Relations with DPRK
articles.content:
Mongolian TV on Relations with DPRK
 Pyongyang, May 8 (KCNA) -- TV of Mongolia broadcast a program on the Mongolian People's Party delegation's visit to the DPRK on May 1 and 2.
					 It showed the statue of President Kim Il Sung on Mansu Hill.
					
					 It reported in detail that during the stay in the DPRK the delegation visited the Kumsusan Memorial Palace to pay homage to the President, went to his birthplace in Mangyongdae, the Tower of the Juche Idea, the Grand People's Study House, the E-Library of Kim Il Sung University and other places and had talks with the delegation of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 It noted that the friendly relations between the two countries have a history of more than six decades and the Korean people are pushing ahead with the building of a thriving socialist nation under the banner of the Juche idea and the Songun idea.
					
					 The Mongolian people will steadily strengthen the friendly relations with the Korean people, it stressed.

articles.title: Nepali Paper on Juche Idea
articles.content:
Nepali Paper on Juche Idea
						
 Pyongyang, May 8 (KCNA) -- The Nepali paper Arpan on April 29 carried an article titled "Guiding idea of revolution".
					 The article noted that President Kim Il Sung clarified the principles of the Juche idea in Kalun in 1930 and indicated the path of the Korean revolution. This is a historic event that proclaimed the founding of the Juche idea and the Juche-oriented revolutionary line, it said, adding:
					
					 The President had thoroughly embodied the principles of the Juche idea in political, military, economic, cultural and all other fields while leading the revolutionary struggle of various stages. 
					
					 The Juche idea representing the new era in which the popular masses emerged as master of the history still now serves as great guiding idea showing the road ahead of the progressive mankind.

articles.title: Leakage of Radioactive Substances Goes on in Japan
articles.content:
Leakage of Radioactive Substances Goes on in Japan
 Pyongyang, May 8 (KCNA) -- Radioactive substances are continuing to leak from the Fukushima Nuclear Power Plant in Japan.
					 The Tokyo Electric Power Co. on May 5 announced that radioactive cesium-137 of 87 000 Bq per a kilogram of earth was detected at the bottom of the waters off the area near Reactor No. 1 of the plant.
					
					This is about 38,000 times that at the time of ordinary survey, it said. Besides, radioactive iodine-131 and radioactive cesium-134 were detected as each 52,000 Bq and 90,000 Bq per a kilogram of earth in the seabed.
					
					 It has already been confirmed that a large amount of radioactive substances are still leaking into atmosphere, according to the survey of the Cabinet Office in late April.
					
					 The work to tide over the crisis of the power plant is going through more hardship with the measurement of high level of radioactive substances in atmosphere and soil.
					
					The work for removing contaminated water was done for several days but its amount did not decrease. There still remains 70,000 tons of contaminated water in the basements of turbine buildings at Reactors Nos. 1, 2 and 3.
					
					 The water in the basement at Reactor No. 4 rose 25cm high in two weeks by April 26, reaching 1.15m and the concentration level of radioactive substances including cesium-137 has already reached the high level defined by TEPCO.
					
					 The remains of power plant buildings scattered by hydrogen explosion also lay obstacle to the rescuing operation. It is reported that if one works for 5-6 hours in this situation, he will lose his life as the remains were contaminated by high level of radiation.
					
					 In connection with the serious situation Prime Minister Naoto Kan said that full measures have not been taken, admitting that TEPCO and his government did not perfectly cope with the accident at the power plant.
					
					 The IAEA in a communique expressed the view that the situation of the power plant is still very serious.

articles.title: Earthquakes Jolt Japan
articles.content:
Earthquakes Jolt Japan
						
 Pyongyang, May 8 (KCNA) -- An earthquake with a preliminary magnitude of 5.3 jolted Fukushima Prefecture of Japan Friday.
					 The epicenter was some 10 km deep in the eastern part of the prefecture.
					
					 Earlier on May 5, there occurred a magnitude of 5.9 quake in the eastern area. Its epicenter was 10 km deep in the waters off Sanriku, Iwate Prefecture.

articles.title: Chinese Paper on US Military Drone Approaching to China and DPRK
articles.content:
Chinese Paper on US Military Drone Approaching to China and DPRK
						
 Beijing, May 6 (KCNA) -- China's newspaper Huan Qiu Shibao on Thursday carried an article titled "The U.S. military drone approaching closer to China and the DPRK" which disclosed the U.S. military threat growing more serious around the Korean Peninsula.
					 The paper quoted an article posted on an Internet website of the U.S. as saying that the U.S. military seeks to move to East Asia most of its drones used in the battles in Iraq and Afghanistan within four years so as to intensively monitor the military movement in China and the DPRK.
					
					 In particular the U.S. is scheming to deploy unmanned strategic reconnaissance planes of high performance, the paper noted, adding: Its purpose is to not only enlarge the ability and scale of lookout over China and the DPRK but also further strengthen the military cooperation between the U.S. and Japan. 
					
					 It also disclosed that the U.S. seeks to ask its allies in the Asian Pacific region to open their flight zones for its high-altitude reconnaissance on China, the DPRK and other countries and offer information to the allies in return for their approval.

articles.title: Gabonese President Calls for Unity of Continental Countries
articles.content:
Gabonese President Calls for Unity of Continental Countries
 Pyongyang, May 8 (KCNA) -- Gabon's President Ali Bongo Ondimba, speaking at a recent international meeting, called upon the African countries to get united as regards the issue of climate change.
					 "The question for us leaders is how committed we are to be a little less selfish and to think of the community as a whole," he said.
					
					 He said that African countries would be determined to speak with one voice so that a new agreement on global warming can be adopted at the international meeting on climate change to be held in the future.

articles.title: WPC President Censures US Moves for Aggression
articles.content:
WPC President Censures US Moves for Aggression
 Pyongyang, May 8 (KCNA) -- The president of the World Peace Council sharply denounced the U.S. moves for aggression on other countries at a forum on Thursday.
					 Disclosing that the U.S. with troops deployed in Afghanistan and Iraq is trying to kick off new wars in other countries and regions, she described the present chief executive of the U.S. as the new face of war expansionism.

articles.title: World Population Expected to Hit 7 Billion in October 2011
articles.content:
World Population Expected to Hit 7 Billion in October 2011
 Pyongyang, May 8 (KCNA) -- The world population is expected to hit the 7-billion mark on Oct. 31, 2011, according to a report released on Tuesday by the UN Department of Economic and Social Affairs.

articles.title: World Demands Freedom for Cuban Five
articles.content:
World Demands Freedom for Cuban Five
						
 Pyongyang, May 8 (KCNA) -- A new international mobilization was launched Thursday for the immediate release of five Cuban antiterrorist fighters unjustly imprisoned in the United Status since 1998.
					 On the fifth of each month, according to the call by the International Committee to Free the Five, people from every part of the world should send emails, faxes and telegrams to demand that the U.S. administration free the Five.

articles.title: African Countries Work Together in Climate Change
articles.content:
African Countries Work Together in Climate Change
 Pyongyang, May 8 (KCNA) -- African countries are keeping step with each other in dealing with the issue of climate change.
					 The leaders of South Africa, Gabon and Kenya recently pledged to work together and take a united stance in an international meeting on climate change to be held in Durban, South Africa in November this year.

articles.title: Satellite Launched in Russia
articles.content:
Satellite Launched in Russia
						
 Moscow, May 6 (KCNA) -- Russia launched "Soyuz-2.1a" rocket carrying "Meridian", dual-use satellite, successfully putting it into expected orbit on May 4, according to a spokesman for the Space Armed Forces of Russia.
